definition: highway/level road
flat/open-hearted/level/smooth
way/route/road
The path of learning can never be smooth./There is no royal road to learning. (idiom)

sentences.english: The course of true love never does run smoothly.
sentences.chinese: 真正的愛情之路並無坦途。

sentences.english: The life is much frustrated, climbing over a high ascent, certainly having straightaway.
sentences.chinese: 人生多坎坷，爬過高坡，定有坦途。

sentences.english: There is no royal road to learn.
Scaling an operating system to support many various units isn’t a straightforward task.
sentences.chinese: 想要打造一款支持許多類型設備的操作系統並非坦途。

sentences.english: Strong economic growth, for a decade or so, offers the only comfortable way out of the hole.
sentences.chinese: 十年左右的強勢經濟增長，是走出深坑的唯一坦途。

sentences.english: The others have built you a highway - fast names in both directions.
sentences.chinese: 人們輔你以坦途，名字卻飛快地奔往相反的方向。

sentences.english: The transition to a higher-wage economy, with a bigger role for service-sector output and domestic consumption, won't be straightforward.
sentences.chinese: 依靠服務業和內需向高工資經濟轉變，不會是坦途。

definition: broad and open road (idiom); fig. brilliant future prospects
rugged/craggy
thoroughfare
dangerous and difficult (path)
flat land one could gallop straight across (idiom); wide expanse of flat country
potholed and bumpy road (idiom); fig. full of disappointment and dashed hopes
thistles and thorns/brambles/thorny undergrowth
lit. a path covered in brambles/a course of action beset by difficulties (idiom)
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
(lit.) the road through Yangguan 陽關|阳关[Yang2 guan1]/(fig.) wide open road/bright future
difficult and dangerous/hardships and perils
untold dangers and difficulties (idiom)
bumpy (of a road)/rough (of life)/to be down on one's luck/to be full of frustrations and dashed hopes
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
long journey/trek/course of an expedition
